[1].text: FC Bayern Munich is a German sports club based in Munich, Bavaria

[2].text: It is best known for its professional football team, which plays in the Bundesliga, the top tier of the German football league system

[3].text: Founded in 1900 by eleven football players led by Franz John

[4].text: The club had its period of greatest success in the middle of the 1970s when, under the captaincy of Franz Beckenbauer, they won the European Cup three times in a row (1974–76)

[5].text: Overall, Bayern has reached eleven European Cup/UEFA Champions League finals, most recently winning their sixth title in 2020 as part of a continental treble

[6].text: Bayern has also won one UEFA Cup, one European Cup Winners' Cup, one UEFA Super Cup, one FIFA Club World Cup and two Intercontinental Cups

[7].text: Making it one of the most successful European clubs internationally

[8].text: The 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season was the 114th season in the club's history and the 48th consecutive season in the top flight of German football, the Bundesliga

[9].text: The club would end the season claiming the Treble, winning the Bundesliga, the UEFA Champions League and the DFB-Pokal

[10].text: Bayern became the first German club to achieve the Treble and the third European Club to complete the Treble in the last five seasons and seventh ever in European Club competition

[1].text: alcohol is one of the best carriers for a fragrance for a multitude of reasons

[2].text: alcohol isn’t susceptible to microbial growth because these microscopic nasties justy cannot survive in such an environment

[3].text: alcohol evaporates quickly

[4].text: it increases what they call the ‘presence’ of a fragrance

[5].text: When the alcohol evaporates, it takes with it many of the fragrance molecules with it

[6].text: perfume oils are synthesized with alcohol to extend scent time

[7].text: Alcohol and sometimes water are used to dilute ingredients in perfumes

[8].text: It is the ratio of alcohol to scent that determines the perfume’s strength and worth

[9].text: Alcohol is a necessary preservative to ensure the integrity of perfume

[10].text: Flavors are usually 70% to 90% alcohol, and part of their role is to provide antiseptic support

[11].text: The majority of perfumes are comprised of 10 to 20% perfume oils that are dissolved in alcohol and tiny amounts of water

[12].text: The amount of alcohol is the determining factor as to whether the blended liquid will be a cologne, perfume, or eau de toilette

[13].text: Maturing a fragrance occurs immediately after the perfume concentrate has completely diluted in alcohol, a process that may take up to a month

[14].text: This allows for the permanent bonding of the alcohol and the essential oils

[15].text: Flavors are usually 70% to 90% alcohol, and part of their role is to provide antiseptic support

[16].text: The history of alcohol being used as a preservative in perfumes may be estimated to the beginning of Venetian merchants selling Italian-made perfumes in Europe

[17].text: Perfume without alcohol as a preservative has a short shelf life

[18].text: Alcohol is one of the main ingredients in perfume

[19].text: Its purpose is to make the fragrance stronger

[20].text: Usual fragrances are a blend of alcohol and essential oils

[21].text: it is hard to craft a good scent without using flammable dissolving and preserving agents

[22].text: alcohol is one of the main reasons perfumes are generally considered flammable liquids

[23].text: Alcohol Helps Merge Different Aromas

[24].text: It is pretty challenging to combine organic (and even some inorganic) substances to produce a cohesive bouquet

[25].text: each ingredient in a fragrance has scent molecules of their own particular weight

[1].text: If the “good bugs” haven’t arrived yet, use a blast of water from a garden hose (or even a sink sprayer for small potted plants) to knock off as many aphids as you can

[2].text: If tender new growth is severely stunted and heavily infested, it may be easier to trim back some of the worst-affected branch tips

[3].text: If you’re unable to bring your aphid issue under control with forceful water blasts and beneficial insects, horticultural soaps can potentially be effective treatment options

[4].text: For more information about horticultural soaps and other natural pest management strategies, check out the UF/IFAS publication “ Natural Products for Managing Landscape and Garden Pests in Florida .”

[5].text: High humidity combined with year-round mild weather encourages fungal diseases and bugs

[6].text: To combat disease, plant disease-resistant varieties and space plants so air circulates freely

[7].text: Practice crop rotation so a crop doesn’t grow in the same place for at least three years

[8].text: Avoid planting tomatoes near potatoes, blackberries, or peppers, because these crops share the same diseases

[9].text: Use soaker hoses rather than overhead sprinklers and water in the morning so leaves dry off quickly

[10].text: Avoid working in a wet garden, which quickly spreads disease

[11].text: Remove and destroy all infected plants quickly

[12].text: Organic methods can replace the need for pesticides and chemical fertilizers

[13].text: Use non-toxic methods for controlling insects in the home and garden

[14].text: There are effective, non-toxic methods for controlling insect problems in the home such as diatomaceous earth

[15].text: In the garden, growing healthy plants using organic methods is the best pest deterrent

[16].text: There are a variety of natural pest control methods such as beneficial insects, non-toxic remedies, traps and barriers

[17].text: Good cultural practices can keep severe pest and disease problems at bay

[18].text: Follow the recommended planting dates listed for each vegetable

[19].text: Rotate vegetables each year so that the same vegetable or vegetable family members (Table 3 in the "Florida Vegetable Gardening Guide") are not planted repeatedly in the same areas.

[20].text: Remove weeds around the garden

[21].text: Pests such as squash bugs, slugs, cucumber beetles and aphids will likely be drawn to your growing cucumbers

[22].text: You can prevent these pests from settling down in your garden by spreading straw mulch out once the soil is warm

[23].text: If you do notice these pests, you can mix a mild solution of soapy water and gently spray the leaves of your plants

[24].text: You can also try neem oil, which is a common solution for getting rid of pests in your garden

[25].text: If you see a thin and powdery residue on your cucumber’s leaves, you can mix a drop of dish soap with a teaspoon of baking soda and 1 quart of water to gently spray on your plant

[26].text: Mechanical control—including barriers, covers, high pressure water sprays and hand-picking pests—uses physical means to reduce insect numbers or damage

[27].text: Barriers, which prevent the movement of pests onto plants, include cardboard or plastic cylinders around the base of transplants or cloth or plastic screening to protect a newly planted garden

[28].text: Screening is most useful for susceptible young plants and seedlings and may provide some protection from frost as well

[29].text: High pressure water spraying, one of the few options available when vegetables are near harvest, is most effective against small, soft-bodied pests such as aphids

[30].text: Hand-picking and destroying some pests may be feasible in small gardens, and can be successful for tomato hornworms and even squash bugs if persistently done

[31].text: Just like in traditional gardens, you will need to rotate these plants between beds to prevent the spread of disease

[32].text: Plant some marigolds next to your tomatoes to keep them healthy and happy

[33].text: Marigolds contain a phytotoxin called alpha-terthienyl which prevents nematodes (AKA roundworms) from munching on the roots of your precious tomato plants

[34].text: Marigolds also work wonders planted near Brussels sprouts, cabbage, broccoli, and cauliflower because they will prevent cabbage worms from joining the party

[35].text: Petunias are gorgeous and come in every colour of the rainbow

[36].text: they also protect beans from most pests and work to prevent squash bugs, potato bugs, and are a good general pest deterrent that keeps most bug baddies at bay

[37].text: brighten up your vegetable garden and protect it at the same time with petunias in every bed

[38].text: It lessens the need for pest control

[39].text: You reduce the spread of soil-borne disease

[40].text: It avoids nutrient depletion in the soil

[41].text: Combined with other organic methods, rotation offers an excellent defence against all kinds of pests and disease

[42].text: Herbs grow well with almost anything so it’s a great idea to intermix them around your garden

[43].text: They deter pests and they’re friendly with almost all types of plants

[1].text: A newer certification (that we also have) that is an indicator of an eco-friendly business is a Climate Neutral

[2].text: Companies that are Climate Neutral certified measure, reduce, and offset their carbon in order to neutralize their carbon footprint

[3].text: These certifications require more than just a corporate social responsibility statement or self-labeling as a “green business”

[4].text: There are many websites where you can find environmentally-friendly as well as overall conscious accommodations, Ecobnb, Book Different, and the Green Hotels Association

[5].text: Before booking your accommodation, it’s recommended to check: if a property is staffed by local employees, if it’s committed to conservation efforts, and if so, what those efforts are, if the property does anything to reduce consumption of water and electricity, and if the property in any way contributes positively to the local community

[6].text: Conscious hotels that set out to make a positive difference in all aspects of their operation will typically be more thoughtful about single-use plastics

[7].text: Another thing you can do is to look for LEED Certified buildings that use renewable energy and recycle their waste among other efforts

[8].text: Look for a B Corp or another third-party certification

[9].text: there are some third-party certifications that ensure a brand meets certain sustainability standards

[10].text: “Reputable third-party certifications are an excellent way to choose sustainable brands because they indicate that a product has met certain environmental or social standards,”

[11].text: “One of the best and easiest to find certification is Benefit Company (B Corp),”

[12].text: “B Corps companies have committed to using business as a force for good, and to undergo a rigorous assessment of their governance, workers (which accounts for labor and equity issues), community, and environmental impacts.”

[13].text: Kaplan also recommends 1% For the Planet, a certification denoting that a company contributes at least one percent of its annual sales to environmental causes

[14].text: One important note is that getting these certifications can be expensive and time consuming, so smaller or newer brands may opt to not apply for them, even if their practices are sustainable

[15].text: Disregard “Greenwashed” Branding

[16].text: Focus on Specific Claims

[17].text: Pay special attention to how detailed and specific they are

[18].text: Hotels looking to be officially recognized as eco-friendly properties can consider one of the many GSTC-accredited certification bodies around the world

[19].text: Find the full list of GSTC-recognized standards and green-certifying bodies for hotels here

[20].text: be sure you’re recognized for your efforts not only with certification, but also on trivago

[21].text: Indicate that you’re an eco-friendly property on trivago by updating your details on your trivago profile

[22].text: Sustainability certification (what some call eco-label) is a voluntary, third-party assessment, through an audit, of an accommodation for conformity to a sustainable tourism standard, the GSTC Criteria in this case

[23].text: Many sustainability standards exist out there

[24].text: Some standards focus on a specific area within sustainability like energy management or building construction, but it is important to use holistic standards that cover all aspects of sustainability in tourism

[25].text: The GSTC Criteria serve as the global standards for sustainability in travel and tourism

[26].text: They are arranged in four pillars: (A) Sustainable management; (B) Socioeconomic impacts; (C) Cultural impacts; and (D) Environmental impacts

[27].text: GSTC-Recognized Standards also cover the four pillars and are equivalent to the GSTC Criteria

[1].text: Grief is a roller coaster involving a wide variety of emotions and a mix of good and bad days

[2].text: Even when you’re grieving, you’ll still have moments of pleasure or happiness

[3].text: With depression, on the other hand, the feelings of emptiness and despair are constant

[4].text: While there’s no set timetable for grieving, if it doesn’t let up over time or extinguishes all signs of joy—laughing at a good joke, brightening in response to a hug, appreciating a beautiful sunset—it may be depression

[5].text: Grief is a common, normal response to loss

[6].text: Anyone can experience grief and loss, but not everyone will experience clinical depression, which differs from grief in that depression involves a range of other symptoms such as feelings of low self-worth, negative thoughts about the future, and suicide

[7].text: Grief involves feelings of emptiness, loss and longing for a loved one, with an intact capacity to feel pleasure

[8].text: Sadness is a symptom of depression, while depression is a mental health condition

[9].text: Sadness happens after a negative experience and may last for a few hours to days and may go away on its own

[10].text: While depression may last for two weeks or more and can cause general distress

[11].text: Sadness is a brief emotion, is subjective, a specific reaction, and a temporary change in mood

[12].text: Depression is a persistent mental illness that changes your life that needs a mental health professional’s diagnosis

[13].text: When a person’s symptoms occur in response to the loss or death of a loved one, their symptoms may be diagnosed as persistent complex bereavement disorder, a separate condition used for prolonged and excessive grief

[14].text: Certain traumatic events can cause symptoms that differ slightly from depression or adjustment disorders

[15].text: There is often a fine line between the two, and normal heartbreak can sometimes transform into full-blown depression

[16].text: However, in depression, nothing seems to matter, Piver writes, whereas with sadness, everything does

[17].text: In grief, you will move through the different stages and ultimately come to peace

[18].text: Depression has less movement between different stages and can simply feel like a heavy weight in your soul that doesn't move

[19].text: Sadness, despair, mourning

[20].text: Fatigue or low energy

[21].text: Tears

[22].text: Loss of appetite

[23].text: Poor sleep

[24].text: Poor concentration

[25].text: Happy and sad memories

[26].text: Mild feelings of guilt

[27].text: Gradually and after an undetermined amount of time, these feelings remit as the individual regains their equilibrium as they return to normal life

[28].text: Depression is a diagnosable, clinical medical condition – that’s why it is called a mental illness, not a feeling

[29].text: Depression is not, therefore, sadness, grief, frustration, anxiety – though debilitating anxiety and panic attacks can be symptoms of the issue

[30].text: Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest

[31].text: And what causes depression? Again, not the same things that trigger sadness (say a breakup ), grief (the death of a loved one), frustration or anger (a job loss), or anxiety (an upcoming test or interview)

[32].text: Supportive Care Resources NCI's supportive care summaries cover feelings such as depression, anxiety, and grief

[33].text: Signs of Depression feeling helpless or hopeless, or that life has no meaning

[34].text: having no interest in family, friends, hobbies, or things you used to enjoy

[35].text: losing your appetite

[36].text: feeling short-tempered and grouchy

[37].text: not being able to get certain thoughts out of your mind

[38].text: crying for long periods or many times each day

[39].text: thinking about hurting or killing yourself

[40].text: feeling “wired,” having racing thoughts or panic attacks

[41].text: having sleep problems, such as not being able to sleep, having nightmares, or sleeping too much

[42].text: Grief You may feel grief about having terminal cancer and the thought that you could be facing impending death

[43].text: We all cope with loss or the threat of loss in different ways

[44].text: How one person grieves may be different from another

[45].text: It can vary depending on how you were raised or what culture you grew up in

[46].text: Some of the symptoms of depression can also apply to grief

[47].text: But grief can also be expressed through constant feelings of sadness, loneliness, anger, fear, and guilt

[48].text: It can even affect the way you think.

[49].text: Grief is typically an emotional rollercoaster, but sometimes this chronic grief can develop into a mental health disorder

[50].text: In some cases, grief may even lead to a state of depression

[51].text: A longitudinal study found that 1 month after people were widowed, 40% of these people meet criteria for a major depression episode, but most researchers argue that this amount of time is not long enough to diagnose depression

[52].text: Thankfully, this depression caused by grief decreased over time, and after one year, only 15% of this population met the criteria for major depression

[53].text: Depression isn’t the only connection between grief and mental illness

[54].text: In rare cases, grief can cause psychosis or the development of psychotic symptoms

[55].text: The mental effects of grief can negatively impact a person’s actions and behaviors as well

[56].text: Grief and depression can look very similar, but they are quite different

[57].text: When grieving, you may experience the following: Sadness, despair, mourning, fatigue or low energy, tears, loss of appetite, poor sleep, poor concentration, happy and sad memories, and/or mild feelings of guilt

[58].text: If depressed, you may experience symptoms of grief, but also the following: feelings of worthlessness or emptiness, helplessness, extreme guilt, suicidal thoughts, loss of interest in pleasurable activities, extreme fatigue, and/or severe weight loss

[59].text: Sadness, loss of appetite and sleeplessness are prominent features of both bereavement and depression

[60].text: Except in the most profound forms of mourning - for the loss of a child, say, or a life partner of many, many years - grief wouldn't shatter you as profoundly as the end of this relationship has done

[61].text: Ongoing sadness and intermittent tears are a normal part of grief; wanting to cry ALL the time, as you say, is quite another

[62].text: Your pain seems relentless and unbearable, as if there's nothing of value or meaning left for you. That sounds like depression

[63].text: Loss of appetite often accompanies grief, but the fact that you have not eaten for days makes me concerned for your health and welfare

[64].text: Even someone in deep mourning will eat in order to survive

[65].text: Grief is an entirely natural response to a loss, while depression is an illness.

[66].text: People who are grieving find their feelings of sadness and loss come and go, but they're still able to enjoy things and look forward to the future.

[67].text: Grief, on the other hand, takes time and patience for healing and recovery

[68].text: The length of time and intensity of grief and depression might also differ

[69].text: Depression can last for weeks or months, often interfering with work, school, and relationships

[70].text: While there’s no timetable for how long a person grieves, unlike depression, the intensity of your feelings tend to lessen over time

[2].text: If you have dry skin, look for cleansing oils or balms that contain fatty-acid-rich oils

[3].text: It thoroughly removes makeup

[4].text: If you regularly wear makeup including waterproof makeup or foundation, or if you wear water-resistant sunscreen, you’re likely to wash your face twice

[5].text: When there’s that much makeup, it becomes difficult to remove everything with one wash no matter how good your facewash is

[6].text: And even the gentlest cleanser can hurt your skin when you use it twice, which will cause dryness, sensitivity, and even irritation

[7].text: Double cleansing dissolves makeup with its rich, emollient texture

[8].text: This makes sure your second cleanser washes everything away without needing multiple uses

[9].text: Broaching the topic of double cleansing - a method which involves cleaning your skin twice in one sitting to tackle different types of impurities – Cook says in some instances it can be useful, particularly if you’re wearing a lot of make-up or sunscreen

[10].text: However, she adds you should beware of over-cleansing as doing so can in fact make skin problems like acne much worse

[11].text: The solution here is to use a micellar water first to “pre cleanse” and then carry out your routine as normal using a gentle formula

[12].text: The point of double cleansing is to clean the skin of both oil-based debris like makeup and sunscreen, and water-based debris like sweat and dirt

[13].text: According to this Korean-based method, if you’re only cleansing once, you’re leaving a lot of gunk behind in your skin

[14].text: To fully clear out your pores and prevent grime build-up, start by washing your face with an oil-based cleanser

[15].text: Because the formula is light, the oil will help dissolve makeup without adding more oil to your face

[16].text: Oil cleanser is great at picking up makeup, but it can easily miss dirt or sweat that leads to breakouts

[17].text: Double cleansing dissolves makeup with its rich, emollient texture

[18].text: It is moisturizing for the skin

[19].text: And it’s especially helpful for people with dry skin

[20].text: Double cleansing is a face washing method where you first use a balm or oil cleanser or micellar water and then follow up with a regular gel/foam cleanser

[21].text: The oils in cleansing oils or balms are effective in dissolving oil-based residue on the skin

[22].text: Once you’re done with your oil cleanser, your regular cleanser removes any remaining dirt as well as the dissolved makeup on the skin

[23].text: The first step of double cleansing is more about melting makeup and dirt and kind of separating them so that they come off easily
